definitions.definition: The sounding of a bugle in the morning after reveille, to signal that soldiers are to rise from bed, often the rouse.
To wake (someone) or be awoken from sleep, or from apathy.
To cause, stir up, excite (a feeling, thought, etc.).
definitions.example: to rouse the faculties, passions, or emotions

definitions.definition: To provoke (someone) to action or anger.
To cause to start from a covert or lurking place.
definitions.example: to rouse a deer or other animal of the chase

definitions.definition: To pull by main strength; to haul.
(when followed by "on") To tell off; to criticise.
definitions.example: He roused on her for being late yet again.

definitions.definition: A carousal; a festival; a drinking frolic.
Wine or other liquor considered an inducement to mirth or drunkenness; a full glass; a bumper.
